alert.note: Alert for Fajardo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 06 at 3:43AM AST until February 06 at 7:15AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM AST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues as additional thunderstorms and showers will move across the area. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following , Ceiba, Fajardo, Humacao, Juncos, Las Piedras, Luquillo, Naguabo and Rio Grande. * WHEN...Until 630 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 343 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
